login.pageDescription: Sign in to your C3i Backup ONE account.

twoFactor.title: Two-Factor Authentication
twoFactor.description: Enter the 6-digit code from your authenticator app

form.title: Login to your account
form.description: Enter your credentials below to login to your account

onboarding.pageDescription: Welcome to C3i Backup ONE. Create your admin account to get started.
onboarding.title: Welcome to C3i Backup ONE
onboarding.description: Create the admin user to get started

form.usernameDescription: Choose a username for the admin account
form.passwordDescription: Password must be at least 8 characters long.

resetPassword.title: Reset your password
resetPassword.descriptionTauri: To reset your password, use the CLI tool included with the application.
resetPassword.descriptionWeb: To reset your password, run the following command on the server where C3i Backup ONE is installed.
resetPassword.commandHint: Open a terminal in the application's installation directory and run this command. It will start an interactive session where you can enter a new password.
resetPassword.commandDocker: docker exec -it zerobyte bun run cli reset-password
resetPassword.commandDockerHint: This command will start an interactive session where you can enter a new password for your account.

volumes.pageDescription: Create, manage, monitor, and automate your Docker volumes with ease.

empty.title: No volume
empty.description: Manage and monitor all your storage backends in one place with advanced features like automatic mounting and health checks.

directoryForm.description: Browse and select a directory on the host filesystem to track.

nfsForm.serverDescription: NFS server IP address or hostname.
nfsForm.exportPathDescription: Path to the NFS export on the server.
nfsForm.readOnlyDescription: Prevent any modifications to the volume. Recommended for backup sources and sensitive data.

smbForm.serverDescription: SMB server IP address or hostname.
smbForm.shareDescription: SMB share name on the server.
smbForm.readOnlyDescription: Prevent any modifications to the volume. Recommended for backup sources and sensitive data.

webdavForm.serverDescription: WebDAV server hostname or IP address.
webdavForm.pathDescription: Path to the WebDAV directory on the server.
webdavForm.portDescription: WebDAV server port (default: 80 for HTTP, 443 for HTTPS).
webdavForm.sslDescription: Use HTTPS instead of HTTP for secure connections.
webdavForm.readOnlyDescription: Prevent any modifications to the volume. Recommended for backup sources and sensitive data.

sftpForm.hostDescription: SFTP server hostname or IP address.
sftpForm.passwordDescription: Password for SFTP authentication (optional if using private key).
sftpForm.privateKeyDescription: SSH private key for authentication (optional if using password).
sftpForm.pathDescription: Path to the directory on the SFTP server.
sftpForm.skipHostKeyCheckDescription: Disable SSH host key checking. Useful for servers with dynamic IPs or self-signed keys.
sftpForm.knownHostsDescription: The contents of the known_hosts file for this server.

rcloneForm.noRemotesDescription: To use rclone, you need to configure remotes on your host system
rcloneForm.remoteDescription: Select the rclone remote configured on your host system.
rcloneForm.pathDescription: Path on the remote to mount. Use "/" for the root.
rcloneForm.readOnlyDescription: Prevent any modifications to the volume. Recommended for backup sources and sensitive data.

createForm.backendDescription: Choose the storage backend for this volume.

tooltips.nfsNotSupported: NFS is not supported on Windows. Use SMB instead.
tooltips.webdavNotSupported: WebDAV mounting is not supported on Windows. Use rclone repository backend instead.
tooltips.sftpNotSupported: SFTP mounting is not supported on Windows. Use SFTP repository backend instead.
tooltips.rcloneNotSupported: rclone mounting is not supported on Windows. Use rclone repository backend instead.
tooltips.setupRclone: Setup rclone to use this backend

testConnection.errorDefault: Failed to test connection. Please try again.

repositories.pageDescription: Manage your backup repositories with encryption and compression.

empty.title: No repository
empty.description: Repositories are remote storage locations where you can backup your volumes securely. Encrypted and optimized for storage efficiency.

s3Form.bucketDescription: S3 bucket name for storing backups.
s3Form.accessKeyIdDescription: S3 access key ID for authentication.
s3Form.secretAccessKeyDescription: S3 secret access key for authentication.

localForm.directoryDescription: The directory where the repository will be stored.
localForm.warningDescription1: When selecting a custom path, ensure it is mounted from the host machine into the container.
localForm.warningDescription2: If the path is not a host mount, you will lose your repository data when the container restarts.
localForm.warningDescription3: The default path is safe to use if you followed the recommended Docker Compose setup.
localForm.browserDescription: Choose a directory from the filesystem to store the repository.

sftpForm.hostDescription: SFTP server hostname or IP address.
sftpForm.pathDescription: Repository path on the SFTP server.
sftpForm.privateKeyPlaceholder:
-----BEGIN OPENSSH PRIVATE KEY-----
...
-----END OPENSSH PRIVATE KEY-----
sftpForm.privateKeyDescription: Paste the contents of your SSH private key.
sftpForm.skipHostKeyCheckDescription: Disable SSH host key checking. Useful for servers with dynamic IPs or self-signed keys.
sftpForm.knownHostsDescription: The contents of the known_hosts file for this server.

gcsForm.bucketDescription: GCS bucket name for storing backups.
gcsForm.credentialsJsonDescription: Service account JSON credentials for authentication.

azureForm.containerDescription: Azure Blob Storage container name for storing backups.
azureForm.accountKeyDescription: Azure Storage account key for authentication.
azureForm.endpointSuffixDescription: Custom Azure endpoint suffix (defaults to core.windows.net).

r2Form.endpointDescription: R2 endpoint (without https://). Find in R2 dashboard under bucket settings.
r2Form.bucketDescription: R2 bucket name for storing backups.
r2Form.accessKeyIdPlaceholder: Access Key ID from R2 API tokens
r2Form.accessKeyIdDescription: R2 API token Access Key ID (create in Cloudflare R2 dashboard).
r2Form.secretAccessKeyDescription: R2 API token Secret Access Key (shown once when creating token).

rcloneForm.noRemotesDescription: To use rclone, you need to configure remotes on your host system
rcloneForm.remoteDescription: Select the rclone remote configured on your host system.
rcloneForm.pathDescription: Path within the remote where backups will be stored.

restForm.pathDescription: Path to the repository on the REST server (leave empty for root).

advancedForm.title: Advanced Settings
advancedForm.uploadLimitDescription: Limit upload speed to the repository
advancedForm.downloadLimitDescription: Limit download speed from the repository
advancedForm.insecureTlsDescription: Disable TLS certificate verification for HTTPS connections with self-signed certificates. This is insecure and should only be used for testing.
advancedForm.insecureTlsDisabledTooltip: This option is disabled because a CA certificate is provided. Remove the CA certificate to skip TLS validation instead.
advancedForm.caCertificateDescription: Custom CA certificate for self-signed certificates (PEM format). This applies to HTTPS connections.
advancedForm.caCertificateDisabledTooltip: CA certificate is disabled because TLS validation is being skipped. Uncheck "Skip TLS Certificate Verification" to provide a custom CA certificate.

backend.label: Backend
backend.description: Choose the storage backend for this repository.
backend.rcloneTooltip: Setup rclone to use this backend

compression.label: Compression Mode
compression.description: Compression mode for backups stored in this repository.

existingRepository.label: Import existing repository
existingRepository.description: Check this if the repository already exists at the specified location

password.label: Repository Password
password.description: Choose whether to use C3i Backup ONE's recovery key (which you downloaded when creating your account) or enter a custom password for the existing repository.
password.customDescription: The password used to encrypt this repository. It will be stored securely.

backups.pageDescription: Automate volume backups with scheduled jobs and retention policies.

empty.title: No backup job
empty.description: Backup jobs help you automate the process of backing up your volumes on a regular schedule to ensure your data is safe and secure.

create.pageTitle: C3i Backup ONE - Create Backup Job
create.pageDescription: Create a new automated backup job for your volumes.

empty.title: No volume to backup
empty.description: To create a backup job, you need to create a volume first. Volumes are the data sources that will be backed up.

emptyRepository.title: No repository
emptyRepository.description: To create a backup job, you need to set up a backup repository first. Backup repositories are the destinations where your backups will be stored.

selectVolume.title: Select a volume
selectVolume.description: Choose a volume from the dropdown above to configure its backup schedule.

details.pageTitle: C3i Backup ONE - Backup Job Details
details.pageDescription: View and manage backup job configuration, schedule, and snapshots.

automation.title: Backup automation
automation.description: Schedule automated backups of {{volumeName}} to a secure repository.

name.label: Backup name
name.description: A unique name to identify this backup schedule.

repository.label: Backup repository
repository.description: Choose where encrypted backups for {{volumeName}} will be stored.

frequency.label: Backup frequency
frequency.description: Define how often snapshots should be taken.

time.label: Execution time
time.description: Time of day when the backup will run.

weeklyDay.label: Execution day
weeklyDay.description: Choose which day of the week to run the backup.

monthlyDays.label: Days of the month
monthlyDays.description: Select one or more days when the backup should run.

paths.title: Backup paths
paths.description: Select which folders or files to include in the backup. If no paths are selected, the entire volume will be backed up.

includePatterns.label: Additional include patterns
includePatterns.description: Optionally add custom include patterns using glob syntax. Enter one pattern per line. These will be combined with the paths selected above.

exclude.title: Exclude patterns
exclude.description: Optionally specify patterns to exclude from backups. Enter one pattern per line (e.g., *.tmp, node_modules/**, .cache/).

excludePatterns.label: Exclusion patterns
excludePatterns.description: Patterns support glob syntax. See <link>Restic documentation</link> for more details.

excludeIfPresent.label: Exclude if file present
excludeIfPresent.description: Exclude folders containing a file with the specified name. Enter one filename per line. For example, use .nobackup to skip any folder containing a .nobackup file.

oneFileSystem.label: Stay on one file system
oneFileSystem.description: Prevent Restic from crossing file system boundaries. This is useful to avoid backing up network mounts or other partitions that might be mounted inside your backup source.

retention.title: Retention policy
retention.description: Define how many snapshots to keep. Leave empty to keep all.

keepLast.label: Keep last N snapshots
keepLast.description: Keep the N most recent snapshots.

keepHourly.label: Keep hourly
keepHourly.description: Keep the last N hourly snapshots.

keepDaily.label: Keep daily
keepDaily.description: Keep the last N daily snapshots.

keepWeekly.label: Keep weekly
keepWeekly.description: Keep the last N weekly snapshots.

keepMonthly.label: Keep monthly
keepMonthly.description: Keep the last N monthly snapshots.

keepYearly.label: Keep yearly
keepYearly.description: Keep the last N yearly snapshots.

notifications.pageDescription: Manage notification destinations for backup alerts.

empty.title: No notification destinations
empty.description: Set up notification channels to receive alerts when your backups complete or fail.

emailForm.toAddressesDescription: Comma-separated list of recipient email addresses.
emailForm.useTLSDescription: Enable TLS encryption for SMTP connection (recommended).

discordForm.webhookUrlDescription: Get this from your Discord server's Integrations settings.
discordForm.threadIdDescription: ID of the thread to post messages in. Leave empty to post in the main channel.

slackForm.webhookUrlDescription: Get this from your Slack app's Incoming Webhooks settings.
slackForm.channelDescription: Override the default channel (use # for channels, @ for users).

gotifyForm.pathDescription: Custom path on the Gotify server, if applicable.

ntfyForm.serverUrlDescription: Leave empty to use ntfy.sh public service.
ntfyForm.topicDescription: The ntfy topic name to publish to.
ntfyForm.usernameDescription: Username for server authentication, if required.
ntfyForm.passwordDescription: Password for server authentication, if required.
ntfyForm.accessTokenDescription: Access token for server authentication. Will take precedence over username/password if set.

pushoverForm.userKeyDescription: Your Pushover user key from the dashboard.
pushoverForm.apiTokenDescription: Application API token from your Pushover application.
pushoverForm.devicesDescription: Comma-separated list of device names. Leave empty for all devices.

telegramForm.botTokenDescription: Telegram bot token. Get this from BotFather when you create your bot.
telegramForm.chatIdDescription: Telegram chat ID to send notifications to.

genericForm.webhookUrlDescription: The target URL for the webhook.
genericForm.headersDescription: One header per line in Key: Value format.
genericForm.useJsonDescription: Send the message as a JSON object.
genericForm.titleKeyDescription: The JSON key for the notification title.
genericForm.messageKeyDescription: The JSON key for the notification message.
genericForm.previewDescription: This is a preview of the HTTP request that will be sent.

customForm.shoutrrrUrlDescription: Direct Shoutrrr URL for power users. See <link>Shoutrrr documentation</link> for supported services and URL formats.

name.label: Name
name.description: Unique identifier for this notification destination.

settings.pageDescription: Manage your account settings and preferences.

changePassword.title: Change Password
changePassword.description: Update your password to keep your account secure
changePassword.newPasswordHelper: Must be at least 8 characters long

toast.tooShort: Password must be at least 8 characters long
toast.success: Password changed successfully. You will be logged out.

recoveryKey.title: Backup Recovery Key
recoveryKey.description: Download your recovery key for Restic backups
recoveryKey.helper: This file contains the encryption password used by Restic to secure your backups. Store it in a safe place (like a password manager or encrypted storage). If you lose access to this server, you'll need this file to recover your backup data.

dialog.title: Download Recovery Key
dialog.description: For security reasons, please enter your account password to download the recovery key file.

appSettings.title: Application Settings
appSettings.description: Configure how C3i Backup ONE behaves on your system

autostart.label: Launch at startup
autostart.description: Automatically start C3i Backup ONE when you log in to your computer. The app will start minimized in the system tray.

notifications.label: Desktop notifications
notifications.description: Show desktop notifications for backup events and other important updates.

appSettings.tip: Tip: Closing the window minimizes the app to the system tray. Use the tray icon to access the app or select "Quit" to fully exit.

toast.autostartEnabled: C3i Backup ONE will now start automatically on login

twoFactor.title: Two-Factor Authentication
twoFactor.description: Add an extra layer of security to your account
twoFactor.helper: Two-factor authentication adds an extra layer of security by requiring a code from your authenticator app in addition to your password.

passwordStep.title: Enable Two-Factor Authentication
passwordStep.description: Enter your password to generate a QR code for your authenticator app

qrStep.title: Scan QR Code
qrStep.description: Scan this QR code with your authenticator app (Google Authenticator, Authy, etc.)

verifyStep.title: Verify setup
verifyStep.description: Enter the 6-digit code from your authenticator app to complete setup

disable.title: Disable Two-Factor Authentication
disable.description: Are you sure you want to disable 2FA? Your account will be less secure. Enter your password to confirm.

backupCodes.title: Backup Codes
backupCodes.description: Use these codes to access your account if you lose access to your authenticator app. Each code can only be used once.

windowsService.title: Windows Service
windowsService.description: Run C3i Backup ONE as a Windows Service for background backups
windowsService.helper: Installing C3i Backup ONE as a Windows Service allows scheduled backups to run even when the desktop app is closed. The service runs in the background and uses a separate data location.
windowsService.helperRunning: When the service is running, the desktop app connects to it automatically. Service data is stored in %PROGRAMDATA%\C3i Backup ONE.
windowsService.windowsServerOnly: This feature is only available on Windows Server.

currentConnection.title: Current Connection
currentConnection.warningService: Service state changed. Restart the app to switch to Service Mode.
currentConnection.warningDesktop: Service state changed. Restart the app to switch to Desktop Mode.
